attributes.action: Introduce a comprehensive take back scheme for medical/veterinary blister packs.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on Government to:-

1.  To make funding  available to medical and veterinary practices,  pharmacies, and hospitals to enable them to take back and recycle all blister packs.

2.  To make pharmaceutical companies take responsibility for their waste under the Extended Producers Responsibility regulations and fund recycling initiatives.

3.  To accelerate the pharmaceutical industry's introduction of more sustainable packaging.
attributes.background:
According to Statista (2023) the top 3 drugs prescribed in 2021/22 totalled 126 million items (definition - each time a product appeared on a prescription). 
Few recyclers accept the waste and at present Supadrug pharmacies (using Terracycle) will only accept an individual's own used packs.

rejection.details:
We have the following petitions open which we think are similar to yours which you may wish to sign: 

Require pharmacies to offer recycling facilities for blister packs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/638669

Introduce environmental packaging rules for medicines and supplements: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634046

Include blister packs for medication in the UK Plastic Packaging Tax: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634377

Require councils to collect blister pack waste as part of household recycling: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634375
